From sametime ...

julianj@ca.ibm.com...	Have you tested the scenario where you answer "No" to 
update manager when it asks whether you want your workbench restarted? I did 
this today and can no longer get my workbench to come up. 
klicnik@ca.ibm.com	Hmmmm, can you please open defect in bugzilla, component 
Update and please attach <workbench>/.metadata/.log and 
<workbench>/.metadata/.config/platform.cfg files.  
klicnik@ca.ibm.com	If you need to get going (after attaching the files) try 
deleting the contents of <workbench>/.metadata/.config/
julianj@ca.ibm.co...	deleted my entire workbench subdirectory and am getting 
an error message telling me to look at the log file.  I'm in a 2 hour call with 
Greg, but once it's over I'll reinstall eclipse and start again.  If I get the 
problem again, I'll open a defect as you suggest.

klicnik@ca.ibm.com	which build are you using???
julianj@ca.ibm.co...	I was on the F2 build, I went to Update Manager and it 
told me there were some updates available, and then I asked for the updates. 
Usually I answer "yes" to the questoin about whether I want the workbench 
automatically restarted; but this time I said "no".  
klicnik@ca.ibm.com	OK, thx

Subject: 
             Re: Update not working.
        Date: 
             Fri, 07 Jun 2002 10:23:03 +0200
        From: 
             Zeiram <nospam@zeiram.org>
 Organization: 
             EclipseCorner
  Newsgroups: 
             eclipse.tools
  References: 
             1




Blake Flaming wrote:
> I have the F2 build. When I go to the update manager and download the June
> 6 integration build, all seems fine until it prompts to reboot. After
> clicking OK, Eclipse shuts down, and a few seconds later I see a splash
> screen which says something along the lines of "Completing Installation".
> Eventually, this screen goes away and nothing else happens. I have to
> delete the workspace directory and start over, but then all my settings
> are lost. Is anyone else having this problem?
> 

Not exactly the same problem, but the latest update also destroyed
my eclipse install. When I try to start eclips, I get a dialog box
telling me there were "problems during startup".  When I check the
log file, I see that a RuntimeException happen, with the following
message: "Unable to locate matching org.eclipse.core.runtime plug-
in."

I tried removing my .workspace directory, but it didn't modify the
behaviour I observe. Has someone a good idea on what I could do to
have once more a working eclipse install?

Thanks in advance.

Best wishes,
        Zeiram

There is a possibility this problem was fixed in Eclipse release 2.0.1. Need to 
investigate the part related to saying 'No' when asked to restart.
This is not an issue any more.
